page.title: 08SLOUGH INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: Slough Industrial Estate was originally farmland.It began with a purchase by the government of 600 acres in 1917.The estate was built for repairing war vehicles and making defence weapons.In 1920 it was sold to private owners.A power station and reservoir were built for the estate alone.Today the estate consists of 485 acres and being one of the largest in the world,there are over 300 companies approx. 24,000 workers.It consumes 3 million gallons of water per day.The largest company is Mars, but there are many more companies producing goods such as computers, videos etc.The area is now sometimes called the 'Silicon Valley' because of all the high-technology equipment produced.
